ovdesc.p: This system updated table is used to store the list of correspondent banks to which the bank is authorized to send a SWIFT message.

desc.p: Indicates message types for which the RMA is applicable.
It can hold wildcards.
Example:

To define an entry that includes authorization for all the Cat - 2 messages with the exception of MT204 and MT207, the 'Include message Type' would be stored with 2* and the 'Exclude Message Type' would be stored with 204, 207.
Together with Message Type Exclude, it will give the messages for which the RMA is applicable.
Indicates whether the record can be updated using an automated upload process in the payments hub.
Possible values:
Y – The entry is manually updated and can be overridden by the upload process.
N – The entry is manual updated and the upload process should not override it.

Any manually updated record in the RMA table is marked as manually updated. Subsequently, the upload process should not go on to rewrite these records with the contents of the upload file. A manually updated record has greater significance and therefore should not be replaced by the upload process.
Record Activation Code generated for the record by the payment's hub.
Possible values:
N - Not active
A - Active
H - History
F - Future
C - Not active future
Unique ID generated by the payments hub in order to identify RMA in the application.
Record Status Code generated for the record by the payments hub.
Possible values:
L - Live
U - Unapproved
R - Reversed
Specifies the date from which the record is to be considered as active for payments processing
Indicates type of SWIFT NET service for which the RMA applies.
At present it can be only SWIFT NET FIN service.
Date and Time when the record was approved in DD MON 2015 HH:MM:SS.MMM format
User ID of the record approver
Indicates the BIC code of the correspondent bank.
Value links to field 'BICCode' in PPT.BICTABLE
Indicates the company ID for which the record is created.
The value links to the field ‘CompanyID’ in PPT.COMPANY
Specifies the date until which the record is to be considered as active for payments processing.Post this date, the record will be set as Inactive by the payments hub.
Date and Time when the record was created in DD MON 2015 HH:MM:SS.MMM format
User ID of the record creator
Unique ID generated by the payments hub in order to identify each record in the application
Indicates message types for which the RMA is applicable.
It can hold wildcards.
Example:

To define an entry that includes authorization for all the Cat - 2 messages with the exception of MT204 and MT207, the 'Include message Type' would be stored with 2* and the 'Exclude Message Type' would be stored with 204, 207.Together with Message Type Exclude, it will give the messages for which the RMA is applicable.
